alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; New Kent; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Gloucester, southeastern King and Queen, east central Charles City, northwestern York, southeastern New Kent, and James City Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 200 PM EDT... At 132 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Toano, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, West Point, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Norge, Toano, Gloucester Point, Busch Gardens, Wicomico, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, Grove, Kings Point, Jamestown, Barhamsville, Eltham, Chickahominy Shore, Croaker and Lackey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; New Kent; York
